review: I am really surprised that antibiotics helped me with my back pain. 100% of my back pain went away. No pain killer or other back pain medicines helped. Most of the doctors do not  give prescription of antibiotics for lower back pain. I was given antibiotics for something else but it cured my back pain . I used doxycycline for 10 days then amoxicillin for next 10 days. I asked doctor to give me second dose because I felt it was curing lower back pain. People suffering from lower back pain please try antibiotics hopefully it will fix your back pain problem.

After a nasty cold, I ended up with a double ear infection. My doctor prescribed amoxicillin. I suffer from IBS, GERD, and gastritis so my GI system is very sensitive. Amoxicillin was absolutely horrible. After one dose with food, I was projectile vomiting, had horrible stomach pain, and was throwing up blood. This is one of the worst medications I have ever taken. If you have stomach issues I would take this with caution. I will never take this again.

Apo-Amoxi (amoxicillin):I was on this for 3-4 days for a bacteria infection from a wisdom teeth removal (nearly 3 months after). I noticed that I was getting constipated, took something for that. Then had consistent diarrhea for 2 days, also with constant nausea. I have since stopped since it got rid of all my bacteria in my gut. Slowly getting back to normal.

I was put on amoxicillin yesterday. I have have had what we believe is a virus for a week, but it spread to my chest and a secondary bacterial infection formed. I couldn't breathe easily, especially in my right bronchial area, there was a burning sensation and my heart rate was higher than normal so I couldn't sleep easily. In the past 24 hours I've had 3 pills and the burning sensation is nearly gone. I had an excellent night's sleep. However tonight the inside of my lips began to swell. I have no known allergies and have taken amoxicillin before. Luckily the swelling seems to have stopped without them getting noticeably large, so I'm going to go to sleep and see how it is tomorrow. I'm tempted to try continuing the course for the remaining 4 days because it's really helped, but I know it's said if you get swelling, that's considered a severe reaction and to discontinue. Curious what others would advise having had a similar reaction.
Causes abnormal heart beat and fainting if I don't stay lying down while on the drug. Its side effects are a tad scary.

I have an abscessed wisdom tooth I was prescribed 875mg amoxicillon for my infection.  I have been taking it for about 2 days and I'm starting to feel relief but I'm still going to have my wisdom tooth removed.

Today is day 7 of my 10 day round of Amoxicillin for an infected toe nail. Yes, it clears up the infection. But, not without intense lingering headaches all day long, starting when I first wake up. Tylenol has very little effect on the pain. Laying in a quiet dark room helps a little bit for about an hour, then it's back to throbbing, ringing ears and nausea. It feels like an intense migraine and tension headache combined.   I am prone to yeast infections with Amoxicillin, so I took two rounds of Diflucan as well. That wasn't the issue this time.

Got some takeaway food and then  days later got  tummy pains that I have never had before in my life.  They were persistent would not go away, in fact got worse. I knew I was in trouble. I got some amoxicillin and I spread three pills over 2 days, and it worked.I took it on a empty stomach works best if you don't drink milk or juice. I would say don't over do this drug, but it works infection is gone. Side effects were  mild because I did not over do it.

Had strep infection of the throat, doctor prescribed amoxicillin and within the third day I had gotten a yeast infection and broke out in hives all over my legs , stomach, and arms. I've had amoxicillin before and never had a reaction, I'm not sure if it was the dosage or not, but I stay clear away from it now.
I was getting my wisdom teeth removed. The dentist sent me home. I took my first dose of amoxicillin. Put me out. Woke up a few hours later with my body in hives. My skin and mouth started to peel

Developed a pain in mouth last Tues Couldn’t sleep with pain so dibilitatingAlso had tenderness in lower gums Went to Dr and he put me on 875 ea of Amox 2 per day It’s now Saturday and pain almost minimal and no bump in gums Guess I gotta see dentist ASAP to hopefully make this thing go away completely

Bad tooth infection and dentist gave Amoxicillin 3 x 500 mg a day.  Day 3 no side effects and pain gone/swelling reducing.  I have had progressively bad back for 23 years due to epidural.  Led to me not able to walk more than 9 paces without serious pain where if I don't sit down my legs will go from under me.  I went shopping with my husband today and for the first time in 3 years I walked around, not one, but two 2 supermarkets instead of sitting in the car as I have done for 3 years.   MRI scan INDICATED the only thing LEFT is an operation which could make better or worse.  What is in this Amoxicillin that Has given me my body back?  I have never felt so well - 20 years younger in fact.  I hope when I finish course I don't get the pain back and can continue to walk.  I think this needs investigating.

Had agonising pain from a suspected abscess from wisdom tooth. Was prescribed amoxicillin to be takes 3 times a day. I am now on day 3 and the pain is even worse than it was yesterday. By the looks of it I’m going to have to have the tooth extracted urgently.

Had a nasty tooth infection from an untreated wisdom tooth and felt like it was going to be the end of me. Didn’t handle the infection in time, had nausea, abdominal pain, the works. (Hence, felt like death). I’m 115~ lbs, and they put me on 875mg 2x a day. The first night I could feel the difference! Amazing stuff!

I was given Amoxicillin 500mg 3x daily for 7 days due to an infection.  On first taking it, nothing really happened.  By the second, I started getting flu-like symptoms.  Third - major fatigue.  Fourth - irritability.  Fifth - diarrhea.  Finally, on the sixth/seventh, that's when I noticed it had gotten rid of those nasty bacteria, and was my normal self again.  As a plus, it cleared up my skin.  Glad I was able to see it through, despite the side effects.

Amoxil (amoxicillin):I had a very painful and serious abscess in my tooth, the infection spread into my jaw and caused my face to swell. Amoxil worked so fast reducing pain and swelling. I cannot recommend enough!

Have IBS, recently got worse so was giving this antibiotic incase I had an infection. Felt fine day 1, day 2 began to feel nauseous, abdominal pains, acid reflux, extremely tired, loss of appetite, headache and feeling very ill in general. I was taking 3x 500g everyday but only managed to get to day 2 till I stoped. Wouldn’t recommend this antibiotic if you already have stomach problems!!

I have had a bad toothache for a few days, and by the fourth day and I thought I was going to die!!  My ear and tooth/crown was hurting like I have never felt before. My dentist called in amoxicillan and after one day I FEEL better!!  This works well for an infected tooth . I promise you that!

I have been having pain in my back molar off and on for about a week and a half. Right above my crown in my back left top molar. Mostly in the gums. Because of the 2020 pandemic lockdown I was trying to wait it out. While talking to my hygienist friend, she became very concerned and advised me that I could have an abscessed tooth which is a pocket of pus that can form in different parts of a tooth as a result of a bacterial infection. That it sounded like it was in the root of the tooth and the pus was pushing out forming a bump in the gums. The dentist confirmed this. After only one day of the bump showing on my gums and one day usage of the prescription amoxicillin the bump already reduced to non-visible. And the pain has also reduced. I was also warned that if the pain returned, which it may. That we may have to remove the small molar. I am hopeful that this will work as I am already seeing great results and already focusing on rebuilding my immune system following this dose of antibiotics.
I took amoxicillin on an empty stomach one night. Couldn’t sleep. Getting up every 10-15 minutes to throw up. Very nauseous. Threw up everything in my stomach. Hardest night of my life.

I have a gland infection. The  amoxicillin medicine started to work but wasn't strong enough or long enough to get the job done.  It ran out & my doc won't give me anything else because I had a drug, even though it didn't work. I had to suffer for weeks because she swore it would go away. It got worse. I can only eat liquids. Had to have a CT scan. Waiting on results. Pretty sure she still won't see anything. I need an ENT now!
They worked for me.

I woke up to my jaw swollen. I went to the dentist and they revealed I had an impacted wisdom tooth and it was abcessed as well. . I'm 31 turning 32 while this is happening so this is all very strange . Anyways the dentist prescribed me amoxicillin and after taking it for a day I could really tell the difference. I continued the prescription all the way and the pain and swelling was probably 80% gone . This was over a ten day span while my surgery to get the tooth extraction was supposed to get approved by my insurance .  A week passed and my symptoms came back heavy and in full effect and I still hadn't heard anything from insurance or dentist so I went back in. The dentist prescribed me amoxicillin again, this is the first night I've been on it again and the swelling doesn't seem to be going down like last time but I'm going to try and be patient. My fingers are crossed that they will get this tooth out of my face soon .

Taking my last dose in about 2 hours from now. ( 7 days of 500mg. 3 times daily ). Ear drainage was more conspicuous during  sleep hours and was much more conspicuous this last night. To me, it would seem that the medicine didn't work as intended. Have had no pain during this episode, and infection was confirmed by Doctor through sampling and testing of the tan colored drainage. Am going back to the Doctor today for further analysis.

I had three 20+ yr old crowns replaced on 3 molars . Within 4 days after delivery of the new permanent crowns I started getting  signs of an infection (I was not able to put pressure on one of the teeth) of the old root canal under newly replaced crowned tooth - I saw a dentist on the first available day after regular x-rays did not show any thing, he did a CT scan and it showed an infection on one of the roots .  I was diagnosed  with old root canal infection, and was prescribed Amoxicillin with Ibuprofen.. My Diagnosis - are pretty much having lost the infected tooth. At this point 7 days later and on the last day of taking my prescription 500 mg  3 times a day - all of my symptoms are gone, pain subsided on the initial day of taking it with a big dose of  Ibuprofen ,Day-2 no pain but soreness was still present, day 3 no pain , little soreness and ability to chew on that infected tooth Now on day 7 anything associated with root canal infection is gone

Yesterday, I was found to have an infection in my gums below a lower wisdom tooth. The dentist prescribed 4 capsules of 500mg amoxicillin for 7 days. I am on day 2 and hopeful. Before the diagnosis, I experienced tooth pain which seemed to spread into my upper jaw. I used ibuprofen and acetaminophen to decrease the pain and sometimes the pain would go away. I still use ibuprofen and acetaminophen while using the amoxicillin. Now my neck hurts when I talk, so I don't talk unless I have to. Talking increases a headache mostly on the side with the infection but which extends down into my neck and up to the top of the right side of my head. I started eating Greek yogurt today and garlic bread. The garlic bread seemed to help relieve a bit of tooth discomfort. If I don't feel better by mid-day tomorrow, I'll call the dentist.

I'll start off by saying I have a severe phobia of anything to do with vomit. This is relevant because I EXTENSIVELY research anything I have to put into my body, and I'll be honest, these reviews put me off taking my Amoxicillin for a few days.I had a tooth infection, I had to take a 500 mg pill every 8 hours for 7 days. To prepare myself, I bought some antibiotics, 4% fat cottage cheese, and yogurt. Two hours after each antibiotic, I took one probiotic pill. I experienced constipation and stomach cramps for one night. As someone who turns into a GIANT baby whenever they have any kind of tummy issues, I can honestly say it was bearable.Please don't take in all the negative reviews you read and be scared like I was. This antibiotic is very common and so many people use it every single day. People tend to leave reviews more often if they're negative. That's why I'm writing this out! Have a great day, everyone!
Was having debilitating pain from an infected wisdom tooth.  After just one day the swelling and pain drastically decreased.  No side effects for me.

Infected upper wisdom tooth, causing pain in lower jaw, neck ear and head.500mg 3x daily.Works great but not immediately.Usually a couple days and your infection will subside.The side effects are watery bowel.Probiotics such as yogurt etc, did not help my side effects from amoxicillin.

I was on a cruise ship and caught a throat infection. The ship’s doctor recommended Amoxycillin. I took it for two days three times a day after meals. The bad side effects were diverse and extreme. Nausea, fatigue, very bad headache, etc. I stopped using it and it took 3 days for the side effects to dissipate. Never again! This drug should be viewed with extreme caution and if side effects occur stop using it immediately.

Amoxicillin worked great. Taking probiotics daily with antibiotics is a must to avoid all the stomach side effects (since they kill bacteria, antibiotics can kill the good bacteria in your stomach that helps digest food- hence the nausea and diarrhea etc etc) if you don’t have probiotics at least eat some yogurt daily. Continue for a week after the antibiotic course is done.

I have a bad bacteria infection from a broken tooth in the front of my mouth. I tried natural remedies that normally work but didn’t this time. My face swelled a lot so ER dr prescribed Amoxicillin. First three doses (500mg every 8 hours) caused excruciating pains (more than original pain) I used ibuprofen with it which really helped my pain for 3 hrs at a time. Then read about liquid Benadryl and milk of magnesia 2 minute gargle. It was incredible. Now on day two 5 doses in, I’m in no pain at all. I also take every dose with a probiotic called florastor to prevent side effects and it’s working too. I have not given 10 yet because I am not done with my 10 day course of treatment.

I had 4 pre-molars removed to make space for when I got a brace fitted. Thought the procedure would be quite straight forward... anything but!One tooth snapped on the way out, so needed surgery. The other 3 all got infected within 2 days of being pulled. (I had monster roots apparently, which contributed).I got prescribed amoxicillin and metronidazole to help for this dental work. It’s day 6 of taking the antibiotics now and I’m still unsure if they’ve worked.Although many side affects! Fever, vomiting, itchy skin, headaches, drowsiness, awful metallic taste, low moods. I’ve now lost 14lbs in weight and I still have the infection. Awful drug!

I was given a prescription of amoxicillin capsules for ten days to help fight a strep throat infection. My throat started getting better within the first day. By the second day, my throat didn't hurt at all. On the third day, however, I started experiencing serious side effects. I had severe diarrhea and  abdominal pain that were so bad that I stopped taking the capsules. I was in bed for two days with agonizing cramps and frequent visits to the toilet. I lost my appetite and didn't eat for two days. It is now the sixth day after starting to take amoxicillin and the cramps and diarrhea are gone. The strep infection has returned. I will not go back to the amoxicillin. Instead, I will wait for the infection to heal without any medicine. The cramps were so painful that I wouldn't intentionally go through that again unless there was a better reason to do it.
I was prescribed 875 mg 2x per day for a boil. Very good med, cleared my boil in 4 days.
I had a severe gum infection with extreme pain , it’s been 9 days with antibiotic and 90% relief of pain and symptoms. Some stomach upset but medication still excellent!!

Age 65. I was prescribed and took Amoxicillin 875 twice a day for ten days for a tooth infection.I have not had antibiotics for decades and it worked wonders not only curing my tooth infection but also a persistent ear infection which had been bothering me on and off for quite a while. Gone! (;>)I also took a HSO probiotic and glass of kefir daily during the course and my stomach/GI/BM are feeling and functioning great normally.Two thumbs up!

My oral surgeon prescribed amoxicillin 500mg three times daily for 7 days for an infected wisdom tooth prior to surgical extraction of four impacted wisdom teeth.  After two days on the antibiotic, symptoms associated with the infected tooth began to subside (i.e. decreased inflammation, pain relief).  Prior to that I couldn't sleep without Orajel, 800mg of ibuprofen, and 50mg of diphenhydramine. I experienced minor digestive side effects (e.g. minor abdominal pain and 2-3 episodes of loose stool) after a few days on the medication; however, the medication was well tolerated overall and the relief was much appreciated.

I never liked the dentist and haven't gone for 35 years. About 25 years ago my gums would bleed every time I brushed or ate something. I would wake up every day with blood in my mouth and on my pillow. I would brush every day but the bleeding would still go on. I got bit by my cat 2 months ago and the doctor put me on Amoxicillin for 7 days. My gums are great now. I brush and floss 3 times a day and no more bleeding!! 25 years of misery until my cat bit my big toe!

I curse the day I was given amoxicillin. The course left me with terrible sores, back and hip pain, kidney damage (not sure yet if its reversible or not) I was never told about the risks, only asked if I was allergic to amoxicillin, to which I said 'No' because I had taken them before, however on this occasion it was more heavily prescribed (maximum dose) which caused me to react with a lot of pain and discomfort. Make sure you understand the risks before taking.
Works for bacterial infection but caused me an incurable fungal infection. I wish I never took it and had treated my original infection naturally.
This medicine is just trash! It is very expensive medication and my insurance paid for it - but its horrible

Day one nauseous. Day two vomiting. Oh my gosh day 3) Diarrhoea three times horrible and night time bad aches and pains. Now I've had sepsis worst pain ever say a 10/10. Amoxicillin 6/10  for pain can't sleep helps if you sit up at night  try distracting yourself by reading!
I've started taking it and only took 2 tablets and the pain is getting worse than before and my face all feels numb my teeth are hurting
Tooth was decaying and infection hit. So I was given this drug and within 2 days my infection has decreased.

All weekend been in agony with tooth ache. I was climbing walls with the pain I was in. Being 9 months pregnant too not a lot I can take for pain. Only paracetamol which never touched it. Managed to get appointment with my dentist and he said I have got abscesses inside tooth he prescribed amoxicillin 250mg 3 a day. Took 1st one straight after dentist at 12pm pain was still there and was killing me. By time I took second one. The pain has eased loads. Don't know if it's the amoxicillin or not. But what a relief so I'll sleep better tonight. I think it's the amoxicillin doing it's job.

Been given as I have a infection in my wisdom tooth which I've got a specialist consultation for in 2 weeks time.So far had 6 of these tablets (one 3x a day so I'm about go onto day 3) No pain relief and no sleep. Not slept right in over a week now but the pain is becoming unbearable.I take morphine, paracetamol & Naproxen for health conditions and none of these have worked with my body.My dentist didn't give me anything apart from the antibiotics and just told me within 2 days I'll be much more painless as the paracetamol should work with the antibiotics. It's 2:28am on the 3rd day several hours before my 7th pill and I'm in so much pain and so tired but cannot sleep. Seem not to work for me, feels like it's getting worse. Will update.

Taking amoxicillin for tooth infection the first day of taking it was horrible tooth hurt more than it did before I started but I think that was the drug doing it's job trying to fight off the infection second day same situation still more pain the third day was great finally no more pain from toothache! Pain free only thing is I woke up with swollen gums.  Side effects from this drug is hard to bare especially for me since I work 9-9. I was very tired on daily basis my body was weak , stomach pain, woke up in the middle of night not being able to sleep. I mean side effects were horrible but I only had to take This drug for 7 days until I was able to get the tooth pulled . Thank God

I was prescribed amoxicillin in preparation for my first root canal. The tooth was sensitive, but did not hurt.  They made me exhausted, alternately chilled and sweating.  Lost my appetite.  Can't sleep.  Skin is sensitive to the touch.  I'm seeing halos around bright lights.  Urinating gives 1/4 to  1/2 cup every hour or so, and I couldn't stop the dribble. I might buy some Depends to save my pants.

I just wanted to point out that it's important to take as doctor prescribes  The common cold is caused by a virus so that is why your doctor doesn't want to give you antibiotics unless it progresses in to a bacterial infection. You don't want to take antibiotics unless you have to. And you don't want to take them continually for more then 7-10 days or for to short of time. Bacteria becomes immune to antibiotics and can become stronger where your body can't fight them in the future. They are needed in bacterial infections quite often but don't just take any antibiotics for the hell of it or with out a lot of research as they aren't good for you over all.

I have just started taking this medicine this time around for a very nasty cold that has gone bad!! My doctor is against giving this medicine to his clients so I feel lucky to have obtained it. I am a 61 yo man that has taken this particular pill several times in the past during my lifetime but it seems to me that it is no longer as potent as it once was. I know that my body may have become tolerant to this drug so that may be part of the affect but i don't think the pharmacy industry is giving the full potency as they once did either. I hope that by tomorrow I will feel much better because I am so sick of being sick!!!

I got put on these today as I got a really bad abscess around my gum and tooth my left cheek is so swollen I can't swollen or eat anything. I've taken the first 3 but nothing has changed seems like it's getting worst maybe it's just me and it's too soon to tell but no side effects for me what so ever just make me abit sleepy..This is prob the worst thing I've ever experienced so bloody painful and uncomfortable

I'm taking for my gum infection, 500 MG caps 3x a day.  The first two days on the medication the side effects were pretty bad; extremely dizzy, sleep disturbance, headache, super strong appetite, dysphoria, severe indigestion, and extreme nausea.  I'm now on day 3 of 7 and my mouth pain caused by an infection in my gums is gone.  I'm still experiencing side effects, but they are at a level 3 or 4 instead of a 9 on the first day.  I am so grateful to have found this new dentist.  Another dentist gave me a different antibiotic a few months ago for the same issue and it didn't work at all.  I really hope this one fully gets rid of the infection.  I can't believe how fast it worked!

This drug was really effective in getting rid of my infection but the side effects were difficult to deal with. The tablets made me so exhausted I really struggled to stay awake all day. My eyes would droop at my desk and I felt lightheaded and dizzy. I found it extremely hard to concentrate. I had to leave work early taking this tablet because I could not focus and many times when my colleagues helped drive me home, they had to help me walk to the car because I was so weak and unfocused I couldn't walk in a straight line. I also felt nauseous for most of the day and had mild stomach cramps. It was wonderful for the infection I had but was the hardest week coping with the exhaustion and drowsiness.

Got terrible reaction with redness and itching all over my body.   Horrible itching despitecaladryl, changing to  Z-pak, etc.    BE VERY CAREFUL AND RE TESTED FOR REACTIONTO PENICILLIN-like DRUGS BEFORE ANY INTERVENTION.

Im 17 years old and have been using Amoxicillin for the last month to keep my abscess tooth Infection down... i have never had to drain my tooth at all... It works great with no side effects for me... I did get a little bit of diarrhea but not much at all... No pain anywhere... NOW you do you need to know that everyone's body will react Differently to Amoxicillin So please don't go by what the reviews say... Test it out for your self...

I've suffered from folliculitis for over 20 years.Pus filled pimples came out on my head and lower neck.The specialist dermatologist here in California prescribed a variety of medications that only would removed them temporarily, and they would returned every time with more pus.Amoxicillin 500 mg. Capsule cured me permanently 80-90% of my decease.I'm currently on my last treatment of 1pill  3 times a day to cure the remaining.

I had tooth ache for days, no sleep and was taking pain medication. Within only  one hour of taking amoxicilin 500 mg it was feeling better  and the pain went away in two hours and has not returned.  The tooth has hole down to the root but at least now I can sleep till it gets pulled

I was treat in an Urgent Care Center for an infection. I am rather sensitive to antibiotics and so warned the nurse treating me. She prescribed the drug (875 mg, 2X daily). I took the first pill with a meal about 6PM. I awoke at 2AM with tremendous abdominal pain and diarrhea. I called 911 and was taken to the hospital via ambulance. I was there for 5 days while they treated me mainly for dehydration. I was near death.

I've been prescribed amoxicillin many times for many different infections. Most recently, for strep throat. I'm on day 2 of my 10-day treatment, and I've never had a problem with side effects other than a little drowsiness. Works like a charm any time I have strep, an ear infection, or UTI. Just wish I could still get it in liquid form as an adult!!

Amoxil (amoxicillin):Had my wisdom tooth pulled and I'm hard headed and hate all medications and ended up with a sinus infection and it was painful. Finally took my prescribed medication of Amoxil and I felt it working 17hrs later. First time I finished all of my medication.
Within 4 hours of taking my prescribed dosage, I had severe diarrhea and vomiting.  I was miserable for the next 24 sleepless hours.
No side effects at all and no infections either!

Had been having severe pains on both sides of my neck and went in to see my Primary Physician.  He felt my neck glands and they were swollen and the pain was severe.  Also ran a low grade temp.  Prescribed Amoxicllin 500mg twice a day for 10 days.  The Pain has subsided and so has the fever.  No side effects, except a little fuzzy headed and lethargic.  Have two more days to complete the therapy, even though I feel so much better.  Would tell anyone with a fever and infection to go along with Amoxicillin.

I started taking Amoxicillin for an inner ear infection. It knocked the pain and tenderness out pretty quick, but after just a couple of days of taking it, I started having trouble breathing. No matter how many times I yawn or try to take a deep breath, it doesn't work. It's like I can't get enough oxygen. It's been frustrating feeling like I can't catch my breath, and has made it difficult to get to sleep. But at least my ear infection is better!

I was diagnosed with H. pylori and Peptic Ulcers. I was given this in addition to other medicines. Had minor side effects such as mild abdominal cramping and diarrhea during the early doses. Best tolerated with food. Didn't stop any of my day to day activities, still attended school.
Amoxil (amoxicillin):Excellent for Ear infection in kids.
Very serious side effects can happen like hives or loss of breath.

I had a throat infections with white dots and puss at the back of my throat. It was even hard to swallow my own saliva. I went to after hours and was prescribed this drug. After 5 days, I noticed improvement. It wasn't as painful anymore. So it did work. I was to take this medication for 10 days, but on the 8th day I was experiencing side effects such as hives all over my cheeks and chest. As well, as swelling underneath my tongue.
Used it with Motrin for my strep throat. Worked pretty well just took a long time.
I was in agonizing pain with my tooth abscess, so the dentist prescribed me this. In 5 days I am almost totally painless.

My tooth wasn't painful when I started this, but after 4 days in I started having diarrhea. I took the last pill yesterday, had to go 3 times and 2 times today, also had stomach ache. I'm hoping it will go away.
I have an tooth infection. Have been taking amoxicillin since last Friday and today is Wednesday and I still need pain pill.

I've got a large abscess in my gum. I was prescribed amoxicillin 500mg, but it has not helped one bit. I've got my tongue, lip and belly button pierced, hard lumps started forming next to the piercings, making them uncomfortable to wear jewelery in. I had to take them out. My mood has changed, I have become unusually irate and depressed. The medication also smells very strong, and very weird.
I often get sinus infections and they clear up fast with amoxicillin.
This medicine was given to me to treat unknown swelling in the brain. It worked.
Works every time!

I was awake with a rampant earache and crying with the pain. Went to my emergency doctor who gave me amoxicillin 500mg. I was told I had an infection in both ears. Amoxicillin cleared it up and I felt so much better and got a good nights sleep.
I used this med to clear up a staph infection, worked quite nicely.

I used this for getting rid of an abcess on my gums caused from a  broken tooth. The issue seems to be a thing of the past. I am healed. The only thing is that it gave me a yeast infection. Other than that, took it as directed and am good as new.
Excellent for many types of bacterial infections.
Amoxil (amoxicillin):Excellent. The best antibiotic. My children respond well and it works fast.

I had an absess on my gum the pain was bad. I took this and within hours needed no pain killers - gave me a slight headache but nothing bad, just a slight cloudy feeling, but its still is a lot better than someone hitting you with a base ball bat. That's how my face felt without this antibiotic. Top stuff.
Oral dosage is easy to take. Felt relief almost immediately. Would recommend and take again.
